Each of the instructions can be reduced to something more understandable. For example, “Apply pressure medially on lateral surfaces of nasal bridge with three digits and pitch toward anterior” means “Pinch your nose and lean forward”.
Each diagnosis is an actual medical condition that can be treated by the corresponding instruction.
Each condition has a common name, but that name may not fit into the enumeration given by the blacked out text. Instead, you’ll want to use the medical name for the condition.
Each clue has a number (or an abbreviation that indicates a number in medical-speak) in it.
Index the number in each clue into the corresponding medical term.
